_header: Behold this great Prince Edward the Second
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 25.
Title(s): ‘Of the Sodein Fal of Princes in oure Dayes’
Subjects: princes, fall of; political verse; Edward II, death of; Richard II; Thomas, Duke of Gloucester; Louis, duke of Orleans; Robert de Vere, duke of Ireland (1386-88); John, Duke of Burgundy; Charles VII, King of France
_description: John Lydgate, ‘Of the Sodein Fal of Princes in oure Dayes’ — seven stanzas rhyme royal

CamTCC600.First Lines:
Beholde þis gret prynce Edwarde þe secoundeWhich of
                    diuers landes lord was and KyngBut so governed was he nowe
                    vnderstondeBy suche as caused foule his vndoyng…
CamTCC600.Last Lines:
…And his destrucioun if I shal not lyeffor bouned he was and
                    did in meschef dye
CamTCC600.Editions:
MacCracken,  Henry Noble,
                        ed.  
             John Lydgate: The Minor Poems, Vol. II: Secular Poems.
EETS
         o.s. 192 (1934); repr. 1961: 660-1.

BLAdd29729.First Lines:
be holde thys greate prynce edward þe secondewhich of diuers
                    landes lord was and kynge…
BLAdd29729.Last Lines:
…and his distruccyon If I shall not lyeffor bourned he was and
                    did in myscheffe dye
BLAdd29729.Attributed Title:
Here foloweth seuen balades mad by dane Iohn lydgate of þe sodeine
                    fall of certayne princes of ffraunce and engelond now late in our dayes (f.
                    169)
BLAdd29729.Editions:
MacCracken,  Henry Noble,
                        ed.  
             John Lydgate: The Minor Poems, Vol. II: Secular Poems.
EETS
         o.s. 192 (1934); repr. 1961: 660-1.

BLHar2251.First Lines:
BEholde this grete prynce Edward the secundeWhiche of dyuers landes
                    lord was and kyng…
BLHar2251.Last Lines:
…And his distruccioun If i shal nat lyeffor banned he was and
                    dide in myschief dye
BLHar2251.Editions:
Hammond,  Eleanor Prescott. 
             “Two Tapestry Poems by Lydgate: the Life of St. George and the Falls of
                Seven Princes.” 
             Englische Studie
         43 (1910-11): 10-26. 
Robbins,  Rossell Hope,
                        ed.  
             Historical Poems of the XIV and XV Centuries.
         New York: Columbia UP, 1959: 174-5.
